RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEXAS LEGACY away well and stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished determinedly four wide in the drive to prove best. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, maintained her advantage into the stretch, but was no match for TEXAS LEGACY in the lane, but battled gamely to preserve the place. SHE'S ON FIRE tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to just miss the place. BETTER WITH TIME broke sharply and tracked the leader in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. SWEET AS HONEY was bumped solidly at the start and forced to take up, raced into a stalking trip while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3w, rallied 3w, closed 4w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied rail, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Better With Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied inside, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,0 00 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000. (Races where entered for $6,250 or Less not considered in Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAJESTIC STREET away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, collared the leader two wide entering the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, but was all out to fend out a late surge from ROAD CLOSURE late. ROAD CLOSURE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished full of run while being carried five wide in deep stretch to just miss. MONTE broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, battled through the final turn from the inside of MAJESTIC STREET, was unable to match strides with that rival entering the lane, and was outfinished late. KLIMTOGLORY away well and was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, continued to save ground entering the final turn, but needed more late when called upon. DYNAMITER settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, raced two wide into the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Monte
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 w, closed 5 w, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Such A Race Since June 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000. (Races where entered for $4,000 or Less not considered in Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPELLANT stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to save ground while biding his time between the pacesetters in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted off the rail midway through the turn, and closed smartly four wide in the drive to prove best. SLEW'S DA BOSS stalked the leaders while racing two out from the rail through the stretch the first time, advanced quickly four wide upon entering the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and finished three wide in the drive to hold the place. COUNTRY COWBOY away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the lane the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, and gave way grudgingly late in a game effort. DEPUTY'S DANCER broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held a striking position to the final turn, before beginning to fade. PARKER POINT away well and dueled for the lead two wide into the stretch the first time, forced the issue from the outside of COUNTRY COWBOY in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2w, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Da Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Mel Corsan Doug and Houweling Len
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 w, advanced 1/2, rallied 3w, led, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $6,750 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500. (Races where entered for $8,000 or less not considered in Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROKE AN BROKEN away alertly and tracked the leader two wide through the stretch the first time, eased off the battling leaders while racing out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped off the rail entering the lane, and was up in the closing strides while confidently handled. LAUGH WITH ME broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, battled for the lead from the inside of FAMILY BIZ in the run down the backstretch, shook clear of his pace rival leaving the turn, and just failed to last. FAMILY BIZ tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, forced the issue two wide through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, continued to battled with LAUGH WITH ME into the final turn, but faded in the lane. FORT LANGLEY eased into a stalking trip one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to trail from a stalking trip in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly one out from the rail entering the final turn, but wasn't able to sustain his bid in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Langley
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGIC ROAD tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, overtook the leader while racing two wide into the final turn, and held BARBERRY BANDIT safely at bay late to prove best. BARBERRY BANDIT broke sharply and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly while drifting four wide in deep stretch while gaining late. SOMTHING ELUSIVE away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished determinedly while being carried out five wide in deep stretch. PETERSON LANDING away well and stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. HE'S GOLDEN unhurried early while dropping back to trail, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive. MAX BOOSTER rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace into the backstretch, was overtaken entering the final turn, and faded in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Max Booster
ENTRY.OWNER: Rocking Bar B Outfit Getson Larry and Getson Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: He's Golden
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Peterson Landing
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A R ace Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANOTHERSUNNYDAY broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, rallied from just off the rail while holding a narrow advantage into the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, but battled determinedly one out from the rail in the drive to reclaim the lead in the final strides. RICHARDS COMMAND settled mid pack while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, advanced from along the rail midway down the backside to take up the chase entering the final turn, overtook the pacesetter from along the rail entering the lane, but wasn't able to fend off the determined pacesetter who battled back to reclaim the lead in the final strides. LIZZIES GIRL away alertly and tracked the leader one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly three out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. WALKINTHEWALK settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backside, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive. BAKZONE settled off the early pace while racing two wide into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact in the drive. BAKFIRE BABY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. STORM CRUISER trailed the field throughout, and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anothersunnyday
ENTRY.OWNER: Leffler Bob Killins Bryan and McCormick Gord
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Richards Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, advanced 3/8, rallied rail, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bakzone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Cruiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed throughout, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALAMAZEUS broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground along the inside, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to get up in the closing strides. RING OF KERRY away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of YOU DON'T OWN ME entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off CALAMAZEUS in the final strides. YOU DON'T OWN ME away alertly and vied for the lead while in tight quarters at the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and finished two wide in the drive to garner a share. PADDY D'ORO stalked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact in an even effort. ANOTHER GUINNESS tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, began to drop back midway to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, through early
